Origins: This video clip of a windmill (or, more properly, a wind turbine) seemingly disintegrating with explosive force during a bout of high winds looks so much like a Hollywood-style special effect that many viewers have doubted its authenticity. However, according to the Copenhagen Post, Denmark experienced two such incidents of Vestas wind turbines collapsing during high winds in February 2008, at least one of which was captured on video:
Description: Another video captured the same incident from a slightly different perspective: A Danish newspaper photograph showed the aftermath of a wind turbine's collapse:
Example: [Collected via e-mail, March 2008] If you've ever wondered how much wind energy there is in a hurricane, take a look at this clip of a Danish wind turbine exploding. Oh, the energy we waste.
Claim: Video clip shows a wind turbine exploding during high winds.
